field_reports.description: Until epidemiological week 26 of this year, 187 hospital discharges have been made due to dengue, 139 of these confirmed cases, 4 cases of severe dengue, in the last 10 weeks there was an increase of 210 confirmed cases, these figures exceed the behavior of previous years; however, the fatality rates have remained at low levels, which means the most successful clinical management in the region, attributed to the adequate and early approach to the patient. 60% of cases are concentrated in children under 9 years of age, while 40% in the 10 to 19 age group, that is, 100% of cases are registered in the population under 19 years of age.

results.summary: Until epidemiological week 26 of this year, 187 hospital discharges have been made due to dengue, 139 of these confirmed cases, 4 cases of severe dengue, in the last 10 weeks there was an increase of 210 confirmed cases, these figures exceed the behavior of previous years; however, the fatality rates have remained at low levels, which means the most successful clinical management in the region, attributed to the adequate and early approach to the patient. 60% of cases are concentrated in children under 9 years of age, while 40% in the 10 to 19 age group, that is, 100% of cases are registered in the population under 19 years of age.
results.name: SLV: Epidemic - 07-2024 - DENGUE-EL SALVADOR

contacts.name: RENE APARICIO GUARDADO
contacts.title: Director de Programas y Resiliencia Comunitaria

field_reports.summary: SLV: Complex Emergency - 06-2024 -RED ALERT RAINS - EL SALVADOR
field_reports.description: The Intertropical Convergence Zone is located on the coasts of the Republic of El Salvador, added to this the Central American Gyre which is a seasonal phenomenon is generating humidity currents that enter the Atlantic, run overland and pass into the Pacific Ocean entering land again, called the Nate effect, these currents will bring heavy to moderate rains throughout the National territory, The Civil Protection Directorate has decreed on June 16 a RED ALERT throughout the country, the expected scenario is floods and landslides, accumulation of precipoites of up to 150 mm of rain are reported in the eastern zone. During the emergency period, 324 families have been evacuated from 35 shelters in Usulutan, La Unión, Sonsonate, Cabañas, La Paz, San Salvador, La Libertad and San Vicente.

results.summary: The Intertropical Convergence Zone is located on the coasts of the Republic of El Salvador, added to this the Central American Gyre which is a seasonal phenomenon is generating humidity currents that enter the Atlantic, run overland and pass into the Pacific Ocean entering land again, called the Nate effect, these currents will bring heavy to moderate rains throughout the National territory,  The Civil Protection Directorate has decreed an ORANGE ALERT throughout the country.
results.name: SLV: Complex Emergency - 06-2024 - ZCIT, Nate Effect Central America

contacts.name: Rene Aparicio Guardado
contacts.title: Director de Programas y Resiliencia Comunitaria

field_reports.description:
The General Directorate of Civil Protection, informs the National Civil Protection System that it rescinds the Orange Alert in the coastal strip and Metropolitan Area of San Salvador, and Yellow Alert in the rest of the country due to Tropical Depression 19-E, of this day and issues RED ALERT AT THE NATIONAL LEVEL according to the Special Report No. 15 of the General Directorate of the Observatory of Threats of the Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources,  about Tropical Depression 19-E, located southwest of the coast of El Salvador, which maintains rains and storms in our country.

It is reiterated to the staff of the General Directorate of Civil Protection, the Sectoral Technical Commissions, Departmental, Municipal and Communal Commissions of the National Civil Protection System; as well as to the general population that all the measures and recommendations already established in the previous alerts remain in force.

Social media are requested to disseminate this RED ALERT widely and sufficiently.

results.summary:
For the following 24 hours, ATTENTION is recommended due to the VERY HIGH probability (80%-100%) of occurrence of impacts related to urban flooding, flash floods and river overflows, landslides and landslides of slopes and slopes, as well as medium probability (30%-60%) of falling branches, trees, billboards and other susceptible elements located on wet soils.
For the remainder of this Saturday 28th: the sky will be partly cloudy with moderate to strong rains and storms in the coastal area, municipalities near the volcanic mountain range, central and eastern areas, with a probability of extending until the early hours of Sunday 29, mainly on the coast and eastern area. The wind will be from the northeast and east between 10 to 25 km/h and occasional gusts of up to 35 km/h in the coastal area, volcanic chain and mountain area, throughout the period. The atmosphere will be cool at night and early morning. These conditions are due to the influence of Tropical Depression 19-E.
Coastal Maritime Forecast Summary: Caution is advised due to the Spring Tides phenomenon; and, in deep waters, by accelerated easterly winds of 40 km/h or more, generating choppy seas and by the strong storms in this sector associated with Tropical Depression 19-E.
Sunday 29: the sky in the morning will be partly cloudy, rains are expected mainly for the municipalities surrounding the northern fringe and volcanic mountain range of the central and western areas. In the afternoon and evening it will be between partly cloudy and cloudy, with intermittent rains and storms in most of the country, mainly affecting the departments of Cabañas, Cuscatlán, San Salvador, La Libertad, La Unión and Morazán. In the early hours of Monday 30, rains are expected for the coastal strip and surroundings of the volcanic mountain range. The east and south wind between 15 and 25 km/h and occasional gusts of up to 40 km/h are noticeable in coastal areas, volcanic chains and mountain areas throughout the period. The ambient temperature will be relatively cool. These conditions are due to the influence of Tropical Depression 19-E, which is likely to become a tropical storm during this day.
Monday 30: Rains and storms may remain in most of the country and continuously and intermittently on the coast and some sectors surrounding the volcanic mountain range during the morning. For the afternoon, the sky will continue to be cloudy, with intense rains and storms, widespread intermittent and continuous, mainly in the central and eastern area; and during the early hours of Tuesday the 31st, they will extend throughout the coast and volcanic mountain range of the national territory. The wind will continue to be perceived as more accelerated from the east and south in high areas and mainly in sectors of the coast, between 30 to 50 km/h. Tropical Depression 19-E, according to the NHC, will probably have been reclassified to a Tropical Storm, and will continue its trajectory towards El Salvador, affecting us with wind and rains in different periods.
Recommendations
The Departmental and Sectional Delegations are advised to exercise caution and stay informed about the weather forecast issued by the Ministry of the Environment, in order to take the appropriate preventive measures during the operation, it is recommended to evaluate the atmospheric and oceanographic conditions before carrying out any rescue or evacuation operation to safeguard the lives of our volunteer personnel.  as well as heeding the recommendations of the General Directorate of Civil Protection in our humanitarian auxiliary role.
results.name: SLV: Complex Emergency - 2023-10 - Tropical Depression 19 E

field_reports.summary: SLV: Terremoto - 2023-01 - San Lorenzo, Ahuachapan , EL SALVADOR
field_reports.description: Desde el dia 15 de Enero se han desarrollado un total de 562 sismos en el muicipio de San Lorenzo en el Departamento de Ahuachapan en El Salvador, hasta el momento las autoridades de proteccion civil tienen identificadas 677 familias afectadas de las cuales 433 se han desplazado a albergues temporales mientras se normaliza la situacion, actualmente Cruz roja Salvadoreña en apoyo al Sistema Nacional de Proteccion Civil se encuantra en la zona en catividades de monitoreo y evacuacion.

results.summary: Since January 15, a total of 562 earthquakes have developed in the municipality of San Lorenzo in the Department of Ahuachapán in El Salvador, so far the civil protection authorities have identified 677 affected families of which 433 have moved to temporary shelters while the situation normalizes. Currently, the Salvadoran Red Cross, in support of the National Civil Protection System, is in the area in monitoring and evacuation activities.
results.name: SLV: Earthquake - 2023-01 - San Lorenzo, Ahuachapan , EL SALVADOR

results.summary: Tropical Storm Julia is expected to enter El Saviador in the early hours of Monday, October 10 with winds between 50 and 70 kilometers per hour and a band of humidity that will leave the country flooding and susceptibility to landslides, 63 shelters and operational tactical units of the country have been preventively enabled ready for any emergency. These conditions are expected to affect about 500,000 in the country's coastal zone and paracentral zone.
results.name: SLV: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Tropical Storm Julia

field_reports.summary: SLV: Inundación - 2022-09 - EL SALVADOR ALERTA ESTRATIFICADA POR LLUVIAS
field_reports.description:
l Director General de Protección Civil, basado en el Informe Especial Meteorológico No. 12, que indica que la Zona de Convergencia Intertropical (ZCIT) se mantiene sobre Centroamérica, además se observa un sistema que tiene probabilidad de que se desarrolle lentamente en ciclón tropical, emitido por la Dirección General del Observatorio de Amenazas del Ministerio de Medio y Recursos Naturales.

 

Por lo anterior, el Director General de Protección Civil toma las siguientes medidas inmediatas: deja sin efecto las Alertas Vigentes emitidas el pasado 20 de septiembre del corriente año y se declara en ALERTA ROJA en los lugares que se han tenido más afectaciones, según el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Nacional, tales como: Cuscatancingo, Ayutuxtepeque, Santo Tomás, Santiago Texacuangos, Rosario de Mora, Ilopango, Nejapa, Santa Ana, Tacuba, Concepción de Ataco, Apaneca, Cuisnahuat, La Palma, San Francisco Morazán, Tejutla, Dulce Nombre de María, Concepción Quezaltepeque, Comalapa, Colón, Santa Tecla, Comasagua, Talnique, Chiltiupán, Zaragoza, San Salvador, Panchimalco, Huizúcar y San Miguel; y ALERTA NARANJA para el resto de municipios del país.

En consecuencia, todas las Comisiones Municipales y Departamentales de Protección Civil, deberán mantener activos los Centros de Operaciones de Emergencia y los equipos Técnico Sectoriales de: Servicios de Emergencia, Seguridad, Infraestructura y Logística. Además, se activan los equipos Técnicos de Albergues, y la Comisión Técnica Sectorial Técnica Científica.

Todas deberán mantener informado al Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Nacional de las operaciones que se realicen en su jurisdicción y deberán mantener vigilancia en las zonas donde ya se presentaron afectaciones, tomando las medidas y restricciones necesarias, en función de salvaguardar la integridad física de las personas.

Además, se instruye a la Comisiones Municipales de Protección Civil, Prevención y Mitigación de Desastres, lo siguiente:

Activar los Centros de Operaciones Municipales.
Monitoreo permanente de las áreas de riesgo de su municipio.
Seguimiento y control de las emergencias de su municipio.
Activar procedimiento y protocolos de emergencias.
Mantener comunicación permanente con la Comisión Departamental de Protección Civil, según jurisdicción.
Integrar los Equipos Técnicos Sectoriales, siguientes: Monitoreo y Alerta, Servicios de Emergencia, Albergues Temporales, Seguridad, Infraestructura y Servicios Básicos, Salud y Logística.
Integración de Equipos de Respuesta Rápida, integradas por: Referente Municipal de Protección Civil, Referente de una Institución de socorro, Líder comunitario, Referentes de Policía Nacional Civil, entre otros, según necesidad y disponibilidad de recursos.
Distribución en puntos estratégicos de los Equipos de Respuesta Rápida, en áreas susceptible a movimientos de laderas e inundaciones, con el fin de implementar acciones de intervención, de forma oportuna e inmediata, como: evacuaciones preventivas y traslado a albergues temporales.
Mantener informada a las comunidades sobre las condiciones climáticas y de riesgo según corresponda.
Se indica a las comunidades en general, acatar la orden de evacuación, cuando lo considere la Comisión Comunal de Protección Civil u otras autoridades competentes del Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil.

A la población en general, se recomienda:

Mantener siempre las medidas de precaución en presencia de posibles lluvias, al transitar sobre la vía pública, cuando haya posibilidad de derrumbes o caída de árboles.
Se recomienda a la población y a los conductores de vehículos evitar cruzar ríos, quebradas, canales o cualquier corriente de agua que se genere durante una tormenta y posterior a ella, debido a la probabilidad de arrastre.
Atender las indicaciones y recomendaciones de las autoridades del Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil.
Se recomienda suspender la pesca artesanal al menos hasta el sábado 24 de septiembre.

Al Ministerio de Educación se recomienda adoptar la modalidad de clases virtuales hasta nuevo aviso en todo el territorio nacional.

A los medios de comunicación social se les solicita difundir esta ALERTA de manera amplia y suficiente.

results.summary:
The Director General of Civil Protection, based on the Special Meteorological Report No. 12, which indicates that the Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) remains over Central America, in addition to a system that is likely to develop slowly into a tropical cyclone, issued by the General Directorate of the Threat Observatory of the Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources.

For this reason, the Director General of Civil Protection takes the following immediate measures: it rescinds the Alerts issued on September 20 of this year and declares a RED ALERT in the places that have been most affected, according to the National Emergency Operations Center, such as: Cuscatancingo, Ayutuxtepeque,  Santo Tomás, Santiago Texacuangos, Rosario de Mora, Ilopango, Nejapa, Santa Ana, Tacuba, Concepción de Ataco, Apaneca, Cuisnahuat, La Palma, San Francisco Morazán, Tejutla, Dulce Nombre de María, Concepción Quezaltepeque, Comalapa, Colón, Santa Tecla, Comasagua, Talnique, Chiltiupán, Zaragoza, San Salvador, Panchimalco, Huizúcar and San Miguel; and ORANGE ALERT for the rest of the country's municipalities.

Consequently, all Municipal and Departmental Civil Protection Commissions must keep active the Emergency Operations Centers and the Sectoral Technical Teams of: Emergency Services, Security, Infrastructure and Logistics. In addition, the Technical Teams of Hostels and the Sectorial Technical Technical Scientific Commission are activated.

All of them must keep the National Emergency Operations Center informed of the operations carried out in their jurisdiction and must maintain vigilance in the areas where they have already been affected, taking the necessary measures and restrictions, in order to safeguard the physical integrity of people.

In addition, the Municipal Commissions for Civil Protection, Disaster Prevention and Mitigation are instructed to do the following:

Activate the Municipal Operations Centers.
Permanent monitoring of the risk areas of your municipality.
Monitoring and control of emergencies in your municipality.
Activate emergency procedures and protocols.
Maintain permanent communication with the Departmental Commission for Civil Protection, depending on the jurisdiction.
Integrate the following Sectoral Technical Teams: Monitoring and Alert, Emergency Services, Temporary Shelters, Security, Infrastructure and Basic Services, Health and Logistics.
Integration of Rapid Response Teams, made up of: Municipal Civil Protection Referent, Referent of a Relief Institution, Community Leader, National Civil Police Referents, among others, according to need and availability of resources.
Distribution of Rapid Response Teams at strategic points, in areas susceptible to slope movements and flooding, in order to implement intervention actions, in a timely and immediate manner, such as: preventive evacuations and transfer to temporary shelters.
Keep communities informed about weather and risk conditions as appropriate.
Communities in general are instructed to comply with the evacuation order, when considered to be by the Communal Civil Protection Commission or other competent authorities of the National Civil Protection System.

For the general population, it is recommended:

Always maintain precautionary measures in the presence of possible rain, when traveling on public roads, when there is a possibility of landslides or falling trees.
The population and vehicle drivers are advised to avoid crossing rivers, streams, canals or any water current that is generated during a storm and after it, due to the probability of dragging.
Attend to the indications and recommendations of the authorities of the National Civil Protection System.
It is recommended to suspend artisanal fishing until at least Saturday, September 24.

The Ministry of Education is recommended to adopt the modality of virtual classes until further notice throughout the national territory.

Social media are requested to disseminate this ALERT widely and sufficiently.
results.name: SLV: Flooding - 2022-09 - EL SALVADOR STRATIFIED ALERT FOR RAINS

field_reports.summary: El Salvador - Deslizamiento de tierra  en Nejapa
field_reports.description: A las 23:00 horas aproximadamente en frecuencia de protección civil, informan de varios lugares teniendo problemas de desbordes de ríos y pequeños deslizamientos; así mismo una llamada de una persona alerta a nuestro número de emergencias que en cantón Los Conacastes caserío los Angelitos de Nejapa, el rio salitre se había salido de su cauce, habiéndose llevado a su paso varias viviendas del  sector. De forma paralela Protección Civil informa vía radio la necesidad de cuerpos de socorro en la zona.  se hacen presentes 5 unidades de Cruz Roja Salvadoreña a sumarse a las acciones de búsqueda y rescate de las familias afectadas, se presume un estimado de 30 familias han tenido un daño directo, en la mañana de viernes 30 de octubre se han movilizado nuevos equipos de búsqueda y rescate, rescate acuático, evaluación de daños, hacia la zona de impacto.

results.name: El Salvador - Deslizamiento de tierra  en Nejapa
